author: costin
msg: The generators.
Most of the files can be easily translated to a xsl template, and the
code is quite clean.
We need first to integrate 4.0, and get everything to work. Plus finish the
changes in the support classes ( mangler, jspservlet, etc), then
convert the parser to SAX. Converting the generators to XSLT templates
is probably the last step.

author: costin
msg: Jasper translation phases. This coresponds to the "mode" in xslt templates.
( one goal is to provide xslt-based translation - those interfaces
will probably disapear )

author: costin
msg: General utils used by the generators.
Some of it will be cleaned up and moved in a generic util package,
like in tomcat ( maybe in commons )

author: costin
msg: Common classes for the code generator.
Missing: Compiler ( need a bit more work on extracting the generator and
abstracting the mangler and javac ).
This is just the first step ( separating by functionality ), interfaces
will change for sure.

author: costin
msg: Jasper refactoring, step 1.
This is the parser - the goal is to replace the interface with SAX.
That will be done while merging the jasper4.0 code.
